#Text=Make Cyber Falls
#Text=The cyber look is becoming increasingly popular in today 's teenagers and young adults .
#Text=This article is for those people who wish to learn how to make their own Cyber Falls hairstyle .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Gather your materials .
#Text=Cyber falls can be made of many different materials , such as foam , cyberlox ( crin ) , plastic tubing or synthetic hair ( dreaded or undreaded ) .
#Text=decide which material is the best for the look you want to achieve .
#Text=Dreadfalls
#Text=Get synthetic hair .
#Text=Purchase your synthetic hair from a well-respected seller such as Cyberlox or I Kick Shins .
#Text=Once you have the hair , decide what length you would like your dreads to be .
#Text=For beginners , it is easiest to start out with the hair folded in half , as once you backcomb you already have a loop at the top , and it will be much more secure to work with .
#Text=Backcomb the hair .
#Text=Secure the hair to a piece of material that is pulled tight , as you will have to pull on it later .
#Text=Backcomb the hair several times , separating as you go , until it is knotted thoroughly .
#Text=Seal the dread .
#Text=Sealing is done by applying heat to your twisted dread to melt the hair into the final dread shape .
#Text=This can be done with a steamer , a boiling kettle , a saucepan of water , or a standard hair straightener with a damp cloth draped over the dread , which is the preferred method .
#Text=Using the straightener , start by twisting the fur-ball as tight as you possibly can , starting from the top and working your way to the end .
#Text=Wet the cloth , and squeeze most of the water out .
#Text=Place your preheated hair straightener over the dread and hold for 5 seconds .
#Text=Continue all the way to the end of the dread .
#Text=Remove the cloth and voila - your first Synthetic dread .
#Text=Thread the dreads .
#Text=Once you have completed your recommended amount of dreads , thread the dreads onto elastic so you can tie it around your ponytails .
#Text=Usually dread falls come with two sides to be worn over two ponytails .
#Text=A standard set of dreadfalls is 30 dreads per side for thin hair or those people with an undercut , or 45 dreads per side for those with thicker hair .
#Text=Cyberlox
#Text=Buy your materials .
#Text=Cyberlox are quite simple , yet the material can be quite expensive .
#Text=Buy your materials from a respected seller , such as the ones mentioned above .
#Text=Fold and sew the crin .
#Text=Using a hair tie or piece of elastic , carefully fold your crin over the hair tie/elastic and secure by sewing with a standard needle and thread .
#Text=Continue this until you have your desired thickness .
#Text=Add some Rexlace .
#Text=Cyberlox look best when teamed up with Rexlace , which is attached simply by tying it onto the hairtie/elastic .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Dreads that start one color ( Ex . match your roots ) then change into a different color ( Ex . Neon Green ) look best .
#Text=When making/purchasing dread falls , make the base color ( or overall color ) match your hair color .
#Text=Dread falls can get extremely heavy .
#Text=it is recommended that you wear a headband in the front of your hair to prevent pulling .
#Text=To save money , if you 're looking for a basic color for dread falls ( synthetic hair )
#Text=go to your near by salon store such as Sally 's and purchase your hair there .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=People will gawk at you like you 're a rainbow-colored unicorn , so beware .
#Text=Many people will ask if they can touch your hair , however , it 's up to you if you want to let them .
#Text=Keep in mind it will be expensive if you order anything online due to paying for shipping and handling .
